name: Companies with worldwide, domestic, and foreign R&D paid for by the company and others and performed by the company, by source of funds, industry, and company size: 2019
description: Companies with worldwide, domestic, and foreign R&D paid for by the company and others and performed by the company, by source of funds, industry, and company size: 2019

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: field_worldwide_r_d_performance_paid_for_by_the_company
variableMeasured.description: Worldwide R D Performance Paid For By The Company

variableMeasured.name: field_worldwide_r_d_performance_paid_for_by_others
variableMeasured.description: Worldwide R D Performance Paid For By Others

variableMeasured.name: field_domestic_r_d_performance_paid_for_by_the_company
variableMeasured.description: Domestic R D Performance Paid For By The Company

variableMeasured.name: field_domestic_r_d_performance_paid_for_by_others
variableMeasured.description: Domestic R D Performance Paid For By Others

variableMeasured.name: field_foreign_r_d_performance_paid_for_by_the_company
variableMeasured.description: Foreign R D Performance Paid For By The Company

variableMeasured.name: field_foreign_r_d_performance_paid_for_by_others
variableMeasured.description: Foreign R D Performance Paid For By Others

specialValues.D: suppressed to avoid disclosure of confidential information

notes: Detail may not add to total because of rounding. Industry classification is based on the dominant business code for domestic R&D performance, where available. For companies that did not report business codes, the classification used for sampling was assigned. Beginning in survey year 2018, statistics are representative of companies located in the United States that performed or funded $50,000 or more of R&D. This change has affected the comparability of these estimates with estimates published for years prior to 2018. Statistics are based on companies in the United States that reported to the survey. No systematic item imputation was applied. Beginning in survey year 2018, these statistics include an adjustment to the weight to account for unit nonresponse; beginning in survey year 2019, these company count estimates reflect a change in rounding methodology.
sources: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics and Census Bureau, Business Enterprise Research and Development Survey, 2019.
